channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not a pothole, a 2m. long narrow gap between two sections of tarmac and as dangerous to cyclists as tram tracks and on a SusTrans bike route in the middle of the road just where cyclists should be in order to turn right into Glencairn Park Road., 9th July
item.description:
On Queens Road at the junction with Glencairn Park Road, Cheltenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Glencairn Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken paving slabs on Brunswick street, 9th July
item.description:
Outside 88 Brunswick st and nearby outside of 86 and 90 there are some broken paving slabs. It would be much appreciated if these could be replaced with like for like slabs and not tarmac as it would ruin the character of the street. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Brunswick Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Clarington Mews, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Please collect barriers promptly following the completion of the roadworks, 9th July
item.description:
A few of the local businesses have asked about the orange barriers that have been left outside our shop since the man hole cover was repaired a couple of weeks ago. I’ve submitted 3 forms to the Highways Agency online but have had no joy or response, and I don’t like to call as it’s not really an emergency, however the staff at The White Hart have had to go out to deal with kids putting them across the road on the weekend, we’ve had customers say they make us look untidy and they’ve blown down twice into the pavement and have caused obstruction to members of the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Drainage block on Green street, 8th July
item.description:
Drains are blocked along the road of 47a Green street. Hedges overgrown and weeds, leaves and mud have now covered the area and prone to being flooded. This road is prone to be a route for heavy rain for due to road being on a hill which then drains onto the main road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The temporary traffic lights before the Esso Garage are dangerous, 8th July
item.description:
The path leading to the road maintenance has caused no proper crossing to be available for pedestrians and cyclists and is therefore causing a danger . When trying to cross from Purton Lane to the other side of Cheltenham Road East, there is no facility to cross the road and children with parents and young children are attempting to cross a busy road where the traffic is not being controlled by the traffic lights. This is dangerous as people are running in front of traffic to enable them to cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
